rules.surveyText:
**ASK IF S6=1**

Family Origin

S6a. Which of the following best describes your family’s country or region of origin? _Select all that apply._
rules.plainTextRule: Only ask S6a (family origin) of respondents who answered Yes to S6 (Are you of Hispanic or Latino origin?).

rules.surveyText:
JTBD1

S10b. You said your reason for having a drink **[INSERT LOCATION 1]** in the past week was best described as **[INSERT S10a ...]**. More specifically, what best describes that moment? _Select one._

**PN: SHOW RESPONSES BASED ON S10a SELECTION. DO NOT SHOW HEADERS.** **RANDOMIZE** **KEEPING SUBCATEGORIES WITHIN A HEADING TOGETHER**
rules.plainTextRule: S10b (the more-specific follow-up to the reason for the occasion) is only asked/shown for respondents who answered S10a (i.e., it is a follow-up to S10a). The answer choices shown within S10b depend on which S10a category the respondent selected.
rules.conditionDescription: Respondent must have completed S10a (selected a reason). Additionally, S10b's displayed answer options are filtered to the subset corresponding to the S10a selection.

rules.surveyText:
PN SHOW BELOW DISPLAY TEXT, S11A, S11B, S11C IF RESPONDENT HAD A DRINK AT 2+ LOCATIONS IN S9

Display Text Location 2: We now want to ask you about a **different drink**. Think of the one you consumed **[LOCATION 2]** in the past week. **SHOW IF RESPONDENT HAD MULTIPLE DRINKS AT LOCATION 2 THIS PAST WEEK:** Given you had **[INSERT LOCATION 2 DRINK VALUE]** drinks **[LOCATION 2]** in the past week, for the following questions, think about the **first** one you had at that location.
rules.plainTextRule: S11a, S11b and S11c (the reason / JTBD / beverage category for Location 2) are only shown/asked when the respondent had a second/different drink location (i.e., had drinks at 2+ locations).
rules.conditionDescription: Respondent must have recorded a second location in S9 (i.e., had drinks at multiple locations, so Location 2 exists).

rules.surveyText:
JTB2

S11b. You said your reason for having a drink **[INSERT LOCATION 2]** in the past week was primarily described as **[INSERT S11a ...]**. More specifically, how would you describe that moment? _Select one._

**PN: SHOW RESPONSES BASED ON S11a SELECTION (SAME LIST PROVIDED AT S10B). DO NOT SHOW HEADERS.** **RANDOMIZE** **KEEPING SUBCATEGORIES WITHIN A HEADING TOGETHER**
rules.plainTextRule: S11b (the more-specific follow-up for Location 2) is only asked/shown for respondents who answered S11a. The S11b answer choices shown depend on the S11a selection.
rules.conditionDescription: Respondent must have completed S11a (selected a reason for Location 2). The answer options are filtered to the subset matching that S11a category.

rules.surveyText:
**ASK IF A4=7,8,9,10, 11, 12, OR 13**

Form of drink 1 and 2

A5. When you had the **[INSERT A4]**, which of the following reflects the form of the drink?
rules.plainTextRule: Ask A5 (form of the drink) only for respondents who selected A4 equal to one of: 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, or 13 (i.e., certain spirit types listed).

rules.surveyText:
**ASK IF LOCATION 1/LOCATION 2 IS ON-PREMISE**

When decided on drink 1 and 2

A6. Which of the following reflect why you drank **[INSERT A4]**?
rules.plainTextRule: Ask A6 (why you drank A4) only when the occasion's location is on-premise (i.e., the selected location code for that loop iteration is an on-premise location).
rules.conditionDescription: Respondent must have the current loop location coded as ON-PREMISE (S9 location mapping to ON-PREMISE).

rules.surveyText:
**ASK IF A4=4,5,7,8,9,10, 11, 12, OR 13**

Satisfaction 1 and 2

A11. How satisfied were you with the drink you chose?


**ASK IF A4=4,5,7,8,9,10, 11, 12, OR 13**

Brand Occasion 1 and 2

A13. What brand of **[INSERT A4]** did you have? _Select one_.
rules.plainTextRule: Ask A11 (satisfaction) and A13 (brand) only if A4 is one of the specified values: 4, 5, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, or 13 (i.e., those beverage categories for which satisfaction/brand are relevant).

rules.surveyText:
**ASK A13b IF A13a=1**

A13b. What other drinks did you have in addition to **[INSERT A4]**? Select all that apply.
rules.plainTextRule: Ask A13b (what other drinks were had in addition) only if respondent answered Yes to A13a (i.e., they had one or more additional drinks).

rules.surveyText:
**ASK A14a-A19 IF LOCATION 1/LOCATION 2 IS OFF-PREMISE**

Purchaser of Alcohol

A14a. When you recently had a drink **[LOCATION 1/LOCATION 2]**, which of the following best describes your role in the original purchase of **[INSERT A4]** for it? _Select one._

**ASK IF A14a=1**

Location of Purchase 1 and 2

A14b. Given you purchased the **[INSERT A4]** for the drink you recently had **[LOCATION 1/LOCATION 2]**, where did you originally make the purchase? ...

**ASK IF A4=7 WAS CHOSEN FOR LOCATION 1/LOCATION 2 AND A14a=1**

Vodka Size 1 and 2

A15. What size was the bottle of vodka you purchased at **[INSERT A14b ANSWER ...]**? ...

**A14a=1**

Purchase Intent 1 and 2

A16. Which of the following best describes why you decided to purchase **[INSERT A4]**? ...

**A14a=1**

Intent for Location of Purchase 1 and 2

A17. Earlier you said you purchased **[INSERT A4]** from **[INSERT A14b ...]**. Which of the following best describes why you purchased from **[INSERT A14]** instead of another location? ...

**A14a=1**

Purchase Reason 1 and 2

A18. Which of the following best describes why you chose to buy **[INSERT A4]** instead of another type of alcohol? ...

**A14a=1**

Purchase Reason 1 and 2

A19. When you purchased the **[INSERT A4]**, which of the following best describes why you chose **[INSERT BRAND FROM A13; IF A13=99: that brand]**? _Select all that apply__.
rules.plainTextRule: Questions A14a–A19 (purchaser, purchase location, vodka size when applicable, purchase intent/reasons) are only asked when the occasion's location is OFF-PREMISE. Additional sub-conditions: A14b, A16–A19 are asked when A14a=1 (respondent purchased it themselves). A15 is asked only when A4=7 (Vodka) AND A14a=1.
rules.conditionDescription: The looped occasion must be OFF-PREMISE (per S9 mapping). Then: A14b/A16–A19 require A14a = 1 (respondent purchased); A15 requires A4 = 7 (Vodka) AND A14a = 1.

rules.surveyText:
**ASK IF A9 DOES NOT EQUAL 1**

Number of people 1 and 2

A10. Including yourself, how many people were with you when you had this drink? _Enter a whole number_.
rules.plainTextRule: Ask A10 (number of people present) only if A9 does not equal 1 (i.e., respondent did NOT select 'I was alone').

rules.surveyText:
**OUTSIDE THE LOOPS; ASKED ONCE**

A21. Which of the following liquor/spirits brands are you aware of? _Select all that apply._


**ASK IF ANY BRAND SELECTED IN A21**

A22. Which of the following brands do you associate with the following attribute: **[INSERT ATTRIBUTE ...]**? _Select all that apply._

**PN: ASK A22 ONCE FOR EACH ATTRIBUTE — RANDOMIZE ATTRIBUTE ORDER; SHOW BRANDS SELECTED IN A21**
rules.plainTextRule: Ask A22 (brand-attribute associations) only for respondents who selected at least one brand in A21 (i.e., A22 is conditional on selecting any brand in A21). A22 is asked once per attribute; the brands presented for selection are the brands the respondent selected in A21.
rules.conditionDescription: Respondent must have selected one or more brands in A21.
